title: Two Rivers Time Trial Training Series
2016 Ronde van Burns
description: Central Arkansas Velo is proud to Announce the 13th edition of the Ronde van Burns summer Criterium series. Newcomers to road racing are strongly encouraged to participate
course: A flat, .8 mile course with 6 turns located in the Burns park soccer complex, North Little Rock, Arkansas.
registration: Opens at 4:30 PM and is race day only. Entry Fee is 15.00 for the first race and only $5.00 more for a second race on the same day. Racers who do not hold an active USA Cycling annual license, must purchase a "one-Day" license at the event for $10.00. USA Cycling event release form is required and riders under the age of 18 must have the signature of a parent or guardian.
notes:
Daily Payouts- The top three finishers in the "A" and "B" races only will recieve 1st-$80.00, 2nd-$60.00, 3rd-$40.00. The tope three finishers in the "C" race will receive medals and Glory!

Series Payout- Points will be awarded to the top ten finishers in each of the race as follows- 1st-25, 2nd-18, 3rd-15, 4th-12, 5th-10, 6th-8, 7th-6, 8th-4, 9th-2, 10th-1. Series payouts will be awarded based on the the total points scored for each group as follows: 1st-$60.00, 2nd-$50.00, 3rd-$40.00, 4th-$30.00, 5th-$20.00 . "A" & "B" races as well as masters 50+ fields are eligible for cash series payouts. "C' race winners will receive medals.
directions: From I-40, Take the Burns Park exit (#150) and go South, follow the signs for the golf course. DO NOT go right on "Arlene Laman Dr., rather continue straight past the golf course and take a right at the stop sign onto "Tournament Dr." continue approximately 1 mile until you will see the Barriers for the race. Parking and Registration will be in the Lot for Soccer field #9.

title: Arkansas State Time Trial Championship
course: Course Description: The course will follow US Hwy 70 east to the junction of Hwy 70 and AR Hwy 31. As soon as the road Y's, turn at the orange marker and return to the start line for a total of 40 kilometers. The course is out and back and pancake at. Riders will start at 30 second intervals. Junior Events will be 20 kilometers. All Senior and Master events will be 40 kilometers. The 1st rider will start at 7:00am. You should plan to be at Galloway by 6:00am to start warming up.
registration: Pre-Registration only. NO ON SITE REGISTRATION. Please register online at www.usacycling.org
notes: * Merckx Division: One day license eligible This division is limited to stock bicycles only. No aerodynamic additions, aero wheels, bars or helmets may be used. Pay out for these open divisions is as follows: - 1st Place - $75.00 (additional prize possible) - 2nd Place - $50.00 - 3rd Place - $25.00
directions: Directions: To get to Gallowa y, take I-40 east from Little Rock to Exit 161. Look for the Galloway Truck Stop on the southwest side of the Interstate 40/Hwy 391 intersection. Proceed south on Hwy. 391 to Hwy. 70. The starting line will be near the intersection of Hwy. 391 and Hwy. 70

title: Battle for Townsend Ridge
registration: online at www.bikereg.com   Battle for Townsend Ridge
notes: Registration onsite will close 45 minutes before each race begins.
directions: Rogers Ar Highway 12 to Piney Road follow signs.

title: Cane Creek Timberland
course: The course is eight miles of fast-moving trails that run through the first hills of the Gulf Coastal Plain. The course is fast and designed for loops. Depending on the CAT you race in, you could race anywhere from 1 to 3 loops.
directions: The race is at Cane Creek State Park in Star City, AR. From Little Rock, take I-530 south through Pine Bluff, take the 530 exit towards Star City and Monticello. Continue on Highway 530 until you come to Hwy. 212 and take a left onto 212. Take 212 all the way to the stop sign and take a left onto highway 114. Go to the 4 way intersection and stay straight. When you get to the stoplight (only one in Star City) take a right onto Hwy 425. Continue on 425 in the left lane and turn left onto highway 293 passed the Southside Baptist Church. The park is 5 miles down highway 293 on the left.

title: Eureka Springs Fat Tire Trail Tour
Lanterne Rouge Fondo
description:
Piccolo 20 & Medio 40 Mile courses in true Fondo style!
Rider Support, Unique upscale rest stops, Breathtaking views, & an event like no other in NWA history!
Strava KOM/QOM Challenges

Midsummer Soiree on Spring Street: To be included in the Fondo registration, tickets to this event will also be available to the public. Food Trucks, Cider, Craft Beer a Street Party for all!
course:
Piccolo 20 Mile: https://www.strava.com/routes/5309245 
Medio 40 MIle: https://www.strava.com/routes/5309332
registration:
Registration and Ticket information will soon be available on our Facebook Event Page!

title: Hell On the Border Arkansas State Criterium Championship
Arkansas State Road Race p/b Healthsouth
Banded Suffering 2016
description:
One of our competitive junior cyclists, Austin Dixon, was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes (T1D) a little over 6 years ago.  Since the date of that diagnosis, he has battled this disease while on the bike, but it has never let it stop him from reaching his goals. Has made it his mission to bring awareness to this disease and change the face of the type 1 diabetes. There might be days he “suffers” on the bike, yet he pushes through it and never lets T1D stop him from doing anything. He wants to inspire others around him, while showing other type 1 diabetics anything is possible.
In honor and support of him and his mission, we have created Banded Suffering to help change the face of T1D.
 
ALL proceeds from Banded Suffering will go directly to JDRF!
 
Life with T1D is complicated and very hard.  The disease has to be monitored 24 hours a day, 7 days per week.  There is never a day off.  JDRF is the only hope for a life without type 1 diabetes. This is why we support this organization and their effort in their search for a cure.
 
So, get on your bike and let us band together to join the fight against type 1 diabetes!
course: Routes range from a very kid and family friendly 6 mile up to a suffer-filled 125 mile with over 10k ft of climbing. The event does include 2 gravel routes as well.
registration: T-shirt color is based on route ridden. Check the website or Facebook for more details. T-shirt size and color are only guaranteed for those that pre-register prior to 9/15/16.
notes: Banded Suffering is a fully supported ride with rest stops every 12-15 miles. The event will include a post ride lunch and beer sampling which is included with your registration!

Triple Crown Challenge Bentonville

Riding three trail systems in one ride.
